case.name: Barrick v Qantas Flight Catering Limited [2007] FCA 835 (31 May 2007)

citphrases.citphrase: new south wales v lepore negligence
alleged sexual assault on pupil by teacher
whether school authority in breach of non-delegable duty of care
test for imposition of vicarious liability. practice and procedure
trial of issues of liability and damage severed

false statement by employer to employee as to condition of work site in course of employment
fair trading act 1999 s3 , s 107 , s 159

usual order as to costs made

citances.sentence: Miller also discusses [3] the Federal Court of Australia case of Barrick v Qantas Flight Catering Ltd [2007] FCA 835 , where statements made on behalf of a respondent (Qantas Flight Catering Ltd) in a proceeding in the Industrial Relations Commission with regard to the applicant in that matter (a former employee) were found not to be made in trade or commerce.
The principal proceedings were, in many respects, bizarre. On 31 May 2007, I gave judgment in this matter dismissing the application: Barrick v Qantas Flight Catering Limited [2007] FCA 835.
